p:
The p-values were then considered to assess the significance of each variable ( Table 3). The p-values of all variables were observed to be significant, except for the interactions between sample-to-water ratio with both temperature and time. Among the tested variables and their interactions, time-temperature interaction, time square, ratio square, and temperature square were found to have negative coefficients. The negative coefficients, which reflect the negative association between the parameters and the yield, may be explained by the possible degradation of essential oil, at very high temperatures, and prolonged extraction times. The use of the quadratic model to explain the relationship between the observed oil yield and the independent variables can be expressed as follows:

where X 1 = temperature, X 2 = wood of A. malaccensis to water ratio, and X 3 = extraction time.
